column1: A canker sore is a painful, open sore in the mouth.
Canker sores are a common form of mouth ulcer.

The sores may also be brought on by: - Mouth injury from dental work - Cleaning the teeth too roughly - Biting the tongue or cheek Other things that can trigger canker sores include: - Emotional stress - Lack of certain vitamins and minerals in the diet (especially iron, folic acid, or vitamin B-12) - Hormonal changes - Food allergies Anyone can develop a canker sore.
Canker sores may run in families.
You may need further testing or a biopsy to look for other causes of mouth ulcers.
